lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''It's Time to Abandon Bilingual Education'' (Op-Ed, Jan. 13) hit close to home. I came to the United States in 1969; I was 10 years old, and I did not know a word of English. Every course that I took that year, with the exception of an English grammar class designed for non-English speakers, was with the ''regular'' students.
abstract: Jose M Rivera letter agrees with Douglas Lasken's January 13 Op-Ed article urging abandonment of bilingual education programs in California and elsewhere (S)

headline.main: California Stumbles On Bilingual Classes; Hispanic Students Lag
